keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up'.
Cagle was not armed at the time of arrest but police found an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle outside the airport.

He faces multiple charges including terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Cagle has a prior conviction for marijuana possession over 20 years ago and is considered a convicted felon.
Authorities were unaware he had already arrived at the airport, where he was observed near the crowded TSA check-in area.
The FBI is assisting in the investigation, and Atlanta Police Chief Darin Schierbaum called it a 'tragedy averted'.
Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens highlighted that Cagle had a semi-automatic weapon and was mentally challenged, emphasizing the dangerous combination.
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem praised law enforcement for preventing a potential mass incident.
The Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport is the world’s busiest airport, with over 108 million passengers in 2024 and a significant global presence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a convicted felon with a prior marijuana possession conviction, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up'. Though he was not armed at the time of arrest, police discovered an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle. Cagle had already arrived at the airport and was observed near the crowded TSA check-in area. Authorities, including Atlanta Police Chief Darin Schierbaum and Mayor Andre Dickens, emphasized that the incident was a 'tragedy averted' due to early detection and family intervention. The FBI is assisting in the investigation. The event highlights critical issues around mental health, firearm access, and airport security, especially at the world’s busiest airport, which is also the headquarters of Delta Air Lines.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to 'Shoot It Up'
